C, c¹
/si: ||; siz/noun [C,U] (plural C's;c's) /si:z/ the third letter of the English alphabet 英语字母表的第三个字母: ‘Car’ begins with (a) ‘C’. car 以字母 C 开头。

c²
/si: ||; si/abbr
1 C Celsius; centigrade （温度）摄氏: Water freezes at 0°C. 水在摄氏0度结冰。
2 C coulomb(s) 库伦
3 (before dates) about; approximately （用于日期前）大约: c 1770 大约1770年

cab
/kæb ||; kæb/noun[C]
1 (especially US 尤为美) =TAXI¹ Let's take a cab / go by cab. 我们搭出租车吧。
2 the part of a lorry, train, bus, etc where the driver sits （卡车、火车、公共汽车等的）驾驶室，司机室

cabaret
/ˈkæbəreɪ; US ˌkæbəˈreɪ ||; ˌkæbəˈre/noun [C,U] entertainment with singing, dancing, etc in a restaurant or club （餐厅或夜总会中的）歌舞表演

cabbage
/ˈkæbɪdʒ ||; ˈkæbɪdʒ/noun [C,U] a large round vegetable with thick green, dark red or white leaves 甘蓝；卷心菜；洋白菜: Cabbages are easy to grow. 甘蓝容易生长。 Do you like cabbage? 你爱吃卷心菜吗？ ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图

cabbie ( also cabby)
/ˈkæbi ||; ˈkæbɪ/noun [C] (plural cabbies) (informal 非正式) a person who drives a taxi 出租车司机

cabin
/ˈkæbɪn ||; ˈkæbɪn/noun[C]
1 a small room in a ship or boat, where a passenger sleeps 船上供乘客休息的小室；船舱 ☞picture at boat
2 the part of a plane where the passengers sit 飞机的客舱；机舱 ☞picture at plane 见plane插图
3 a small wooden house; a hut 小木屋: a log cabin 一间小圆木屋 ☞picture on page C8 见C8页插图

ˈcabin cruiser
noun [C] =CRUISER(2)

cabinet
/ˈkæbɪnət ||; ˈkæbənɪt/noun[C]
1 a cupboard with shelves or drawers, used for storing things （有搁板或抽屉的）橱，柜: a medicine cabinet 药柜 a filing cabinet 文件柜
2 (also the Cabinet) [with.sop] the most important ministers in a government, who have regular meetings with the Prime Minister 内阁: The Cabinet is/are meeting today to discuss the crisis. 内阁今天要开会商讨危机。

cable
/ˈkeɪbl ||; ˈkebḷ/noun
1 [C] a thick strong metal rope （金属的）缆，索
2 [C,U] a set of wires covered with plastic, etc, for carrying electricity or signals 电缆；电线: underground/overhead cables 地下╱架空电缆 a telephone cable 电话电缆 two metres of cable 两公尺电缆 ☞pictures at plug and on page C8 见plug及C8页插图
3 =CABLE TELEVISION

ˈcable car
noun [C] a vehicle like a box that hangs on a moving metal rope (cable) and carries passengers up and down a mountain 缆车 ☞picture on page C8 见C8页插图

ˌcable ˈtelevision
noun [U] a system of sending out television programmes along wires instead of by radio signals 有线电视

cache
/kæʃ ||; kæʃ/noun[C]
1 an amount of sth, especially drugs or weapons, that has been hidden 秘藏某物的数量（尤指毒品或武器）
2 (computing计算机技术) a part of a computer's memory that stores copies of data so that the data can be found very quickly 高速缓冲存储

cackle
/ˈkækl ||; ˈkækḷ/verb [I] to laugh in a loud, unpleasant way 难听地大笑 cackle noun [C]

cactus
/ˈkæktəs ||; ˈkæktəs/noun [C] (plural cactuses or cacti /ˈkæktaɪ ||; ˈkæktaɪ/) a type of plant that grows in hot, dry areas, especially deserts. A cactus has a thick central part (stem)and sharp points (prickles) but no leaves. 仙人掌 ☞picture on page C2 见C2页插图

CAD
/kæd;ˌsi: eɪ ˈdi: ||; kæd; ˌsi e ˈdi/noun [U] the abbreviation for ‘computer aided design’ (the use of computers to design machines, buildings, vehicles, etc) 电脑辅助设计；计算机辅助设计

cadaver
/kəˈdævə(r) ||; kəˈdævɚ/noun [C] (formal 正式) the body of a dead person （人的）尸体

CADCAM ( also CAD/CAM)
/ˈkædkæm ||; ˈkædˌkæm/abbr computer-aided design, computer-aided manufacturing; the use of computers to design and make buildings, vehicles, etc 计算机辅助设计和制造

caddie
/ˈkædi ||; ˈkædɪ/ (also caddy (plural caddies)) noun [C] a person who helps a golf player during a game by carrying his or her equipment (clubs) ﹙高尔夫球运动中的﹚球童

cadence
/ˈkeɪdns ||; ˈkedṇs/noun[C]
1 (formal 正式) the rise and fall of the voice in speaking （说话声的）起落，抑扬顿挫
2 the end of a musical phrase （音乐）终止式

cadenza
/kəˈdenzə ||; kəˈdɛnzə/noun [C] (in classical music) a short passage that is put into a piece of music to be played by one musician alone, and that shows the skill of that musician （古典音乐）华彩段（由一名乐师独奏以显示其技巧的乐章）

cadet
/kəˈdet ||; kəˈdɛt/noun [C] a young person who is training to be in the army, navy, air force or police （军校或警察学校的）学员，士官生

cadge
/kædʒ ||; kædʒ/verb [I,T] (informal 非正式)cadge (sth) (from/off sb) to try to persuade sb to give or lend you sth 试图说服某人给予或借予: He's always trying to cadge money off me. 他老是想要从我这里弄到钱。

cadmium
/ˈkædmiəm ||; ˈkædmɪəm/noun [U] (symbol Cd) a soft poisonous bluish-white metal that is used in batteries and in some industries 镉

Caesarean
/siˈzeəriən ||; sɪˈzɛrɪən/ (also -rian (US also 美亦作) cesarean) noun [C] a medical operation in which an opening is cut in a mother's body in order to take out the baby when a normal birth would be impossible or dangerous 剖腹产手术: to have a Caesarean 接受剖腹产手术 This operation is also called a Caesarean section or in American English a C-section. 这个手术亦叫做 Caesarean section，美国英语中叫做 C-section。

ˌCaesar ˈsalad
/ˌsizə ˈsæləd ||; ˌsɪzɚ ˈsæləd/noun [C] a salad made with cheese, small pieces of fried bread (croutons) and a sauce (dressing) with a strong flavour 西泽色拉﹙用干酪、油炸面包丁加调料配制成﹚

caesium
/ˈsi:ziəm ||; ˈsizɪəm/ (US 美 cesium) noun [U] (symbol Cs) a soft silver-white metal 铯

*cafe
/ˈkæfeɪ; US kæˈfeɪ ||; kæˈfe/noun [C] a small restaurant that serves drinks and light meals 小餐馆；咖啡馆 In Britain, a cafe does not normally serve alcoholic drinks, which are served in a pub or bar. 在英国，咖啡馆一般不供应含酒精的饮料，酒类饮料可以在酒馆(pub)或酒吧(bar)买到。 ☞picture on page C8 见C8页插图

cafeteria
/ˌkæfəˈtɪəriə ||; ˌkæfəˈtɪrɪə/noun [C] a restaurant, especially one for staff or workers, where people collect their meals themselves and carry them to their tables （尤指专为员工而设的）自助食堂，自助餐厅 ☞Look at canteen. 参看 canteen。

cafetière
/ˌkæfəˈtjeə(r) ||; ˌkæfəˈtjɛr/noun [C] a special glass container for making coffee with a metal part(filter)that you push down （带过滤器的）咖啡壶 ☞Compare percolator. 与 percolator 比较。

caffeine
/ˈkæfi:n ||; ˈkæfin/noun [U] the substance found in coffee and tea that makes you feel more awake and full of energy 咖啡因；咖啡碱 ☞Look at decaffeinated. 参看 decaffeinated。

caffè latte ( also caffe latte, latte)
/ˌkæfeɪ ˈlɑ:teɪ ||; ˌkæfe ˈlɑte/noun [C] (plural lattes) a drink made by adding a small amount of strong coffee to a cup of hot milk 热奶沫咖啡；拿铁咖啡

*cage
/keɪdʒ ||; kedʒ/noun [C] a box made of bars or wire, or a space surrounded by wire or metal bars, in which a bird or animal is kept so that it cannot escape 鸟笼；兽笼: a birdcage 鸟笼 cage verb [T] ➔caged /keɪdʒd ||; kedʒd/ adj He felt like a caged animal in the tiny office. 他觉得在这小小的办公室就如笼中困兽。

cagey
/ˈkeɪdʒi ||; ˈkedʒɪ/adj (informal 非正式)cagey (about sth) not wanting to give information or to talk about sth 守口如瓶

cagoule
/kəˈgu:l ||; kəˈgul/noun [C] a long jacket with a covering for the head (hood) that protects you from the rain or wind 连帽长雨衣；连帽防风衣 ☞picture on page C6 见C6页插图

cajole
/kəˈdʒəʊl ||; kəˈdʒol/verb [T] [I] cajole (sb) (into sth/into doing sth);cajole sth out of sb to persuade a person to do sth or give sth by being very nice to him/her （用甜言蜜语）哄骗，劝诱: He cajoled me into agreeing to do the work. 他劝诱我答应做这项工作。

*cake¹
/keɪk ||; kek/noun
1 [C,U] a sweet food made by mixing flour, eggs, butter, sugar, etc together and baking the mixture in the oven 蛋糕: to make/bake a cake 做╱烤蛋糕 a wedding cake 结婚蛋糕 a piece/slice of birthday cake 一块生日蛋糕 Would you like some more cake? 还要点蛋糕吗？
2 [C] a mixture of other food, cooked in a round, flat shape 饼状食物: fish/potato cakes 煎鱼饼；马铃薯饼
have your cake and eat it to enjoy the advantages of sth without its disadvantages; to have both things that are available 只占便宜而不吃亏；两者兼得: You can't go out every night and pass your exams. You can't have your cake and eat it. 你又要每晚外出，又要考试及格，天下哪有鱼与熊掌兼得的事。 a piece of cake→PIECE¹
cake²
/keɪk ||; kek/verb [T] (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) cake sth (in/with sth) to cover sth thickly with a substance that becomes hard when it dries 干后变硬的物质厚厚地覆盖在某物之上: boots caked in mud 沾满泥块的靴子

calamity
/kəlˈæməti ||; kəˈlæmətɪ/noun [C,U] (plural calamities) a terrible event that causes a lot of damage or harm 灾难；灾祸

calcify
/ˈkælsɪfaɪ ||; ˈkælsəˌfaɪ/verb [I,T] (present participle calcifying third person singular present calcifies;past tense past participle calcified) (technical术语) to become hard or make sth hard by adding CALCIUMsalts （使）钙化 ➔calcification /ˌkælsɪfɪˈkeɪʃn ||; ˌkælsəfəˈkeʃən/ noun [U]

calcium
/ˈkælsiəm ||; ˈkælsɪəm/noun [U] (symbol Ca) a chemical element that is found in foods such as milk and cheese. It helps to make bones and teeth strong. 钙

ˌcalcium ˈcarbonate
noun [U] (symbol CaCO₃) a white solid that exists naturally as chalk, LIMESTONE (= a type of white stone used in building) and MARBLE (= a type of white stone that can be polished smooth and is used in building and for making statues) 碳酸钙（存在于白垩、灰岩及大理石中）

*calculate
/ˈkælkjuleɪt ||; ˈkælkjəˌlet/verb[T]
1 to find sth out by using mathematics; to work sth out （用数学方法）计算，算出: It's difficult to calculate how long the project will take. 要算出这个工程要干多久是很难的。
2 to consider or expect sth 考虑；预料: We calculated that the advantages would be greater than the disadvantages. 我们认为利大于弊。
be calculated to do sth to be intended or designed to do sth 以…为目的: His remark was clearly calculated to annoy me. 他批评我的目的显然是要烦扰我。

calculating
/ˈkælkjuleɪtɪŋ ||; ˈkælkjəˌletɪŋ/adj planning things in a very careful way in order to achieve what you want, without considering other people 精于为自己谋算的；工于心计的: Her cold, calculating approach made her many enemies. 她态度冷漠，又工于心计，所以树敌众多。

calculation
/ˌkælkjuˈleɪʃn ||; ˌkælkjəˈleʃən/noun
1 [C,U] finding an answer by using mathematics （用数学方法）计算: I'll have to do a few calculationsbefore telling you how much I can afford. 我要做一些运算才能告诉你我花得起多少钱。 Calculation of the exact cost is impossible. 要给成本算出一个准确的数字是不可能的。
2 [U] (formal 正式) careful planning in order to achieve what you want, without considering other people 处心积虑（为谋私利）: His actions were clearly the result of deliberate calculation. 他的所作所为显然都是深思熟虑的结果。

calculator
/ˈkælkjuleɪtə(r) ||; ˈkælkjəˌletɚ/noun [C] a small electronic machine used for calculating figures 计算器: a pocket calculator 袖珍计算器

calculus
/ˈkælkjələs ||; ˈkælkjələs/noun [U] (mathematics数学) a type of mathematics that deals with rates of change, for example the speed of a falling object 微积分（学）

caldron
(especially US 尤为美) =CAULDRON

*calendar
/ˈkælɪndə(r) ||; ˈkæləndɚ/noun[C]
1 a list that shows the days, weeks and months of a particular year 日历；月历；年历
A calendar is often hung on a wall and may have a separate page for each month, sometimes with a picture or photograph. A diary is a little book which you can carry around with you and which has spaces next to the dates so that you can write in appointments, etc. 日历(calendar)一般挂在墙上，有些每月一页，可能附有图片。记事簿(diary)便于携带，日期旁的空白处可写上约会或其他事项。
2 a system for dividing time into fixed periods and for marking the beginning and end of a year 历法: the Muslim calendar 穆斯林历
3 a list of dates and events in a year that are important in a particular area of activity （某类活动的）全年大事表: Wimbledon is a major event in the sporting calendar. 温布尔顿网球赛是体坛每年的一大盛事。

ˌcalendar ˈmonth
=MONTH(1)

ˌcalendar ˈyear
=YEAR(1)

calf
/kɑ:f; US kæf ||; kæf/noun [C] (plural calves /kɑ:vz; US kævz ||; kævz/)
1 a young cow 牛犊；小牛 ☞Look at the note and picture at cow. 参看cow的注释及插图。 ☞The meat from a calf is called veal. Look at the note at meat. 供食用的小牛肉叫做 veal。参看 meat 的注释。
2 the young of some other animals, for example elephants （某些动物的）仔畜，仔兽
3 the back of your leg, below your knee 腓，腿肚子（指小腿后面隆起的部份）: I've strained a calf muscle. 我扭伤了一条腿肚子的肌肉。 ☞picture at body 见body插图

calibrate
/ˈkælɪbreɪt ||; ˈkæləˌbret/verb [T] (technical术语) to mark units of measurement on an instrument so that it can be used for measuring sth accurately 标定（量器上的刻度）

calibration
/ˌkælɪˈbreɪʃn ||; ˌkæləˈbreʃən/noun (technical术语)
1 [U] the act of marking units of measurement on an instrument so that it can be used for measuring sth accurately （量器上刻度的）标定
2 [C] the units marked on an instrument that is used for measuring such as a THERMOMETER （量器上的）刻度

calibre
/ˈkælɪbə(r) ||; ˈkæləbɚ/ (US 美 caliber) noun [sing] [U] the quality or ability of a person or thing 才力；才能: The company's employees are of (a) high calibre. 这家公司的职员个个都极能干。

caliper
(especially US 尤为美) =CALLIPER

CALL
/kɔ:l ||; kɔl/abbr computer-assisted language learning 计算机辅助语言学习

*call¹
/kɔ:l ||; kɔl/verb
1 [I,T] call (out) to sb;call (sth) (out) to say sth loudly or to shout in order to attract attention 叫喊: ‘Hello, is anybody there?’ she called. 她喊道﹕“喂，有人在吗？” He called out the names and the winners stepped forward. 他读出了优胜者的名字，他们就都站到前面来。 I could hear a man calling his dog. 我听见一名男子在叫他的狗。
2 [I,T] to telephone sb 给某人打电话: Who's calling, please? 你是哪位？ I'll call you tomorrow. 我明天给你打电话。 We're just in the middle of dinner. Can I call you back later? 我们在吃晚饭呢，过一会儿再给你回电话行吗？
3 [T] to name or describe a person or thing in a certain way 把…叫做或称作: They called the baby Freddie. 他们给婴儿取名弗雷迪。 It was very rude to call her fat. 当她的面说她胖，太不客气了。 Are you calling me a liar? 你说我撒谎，是不是？
4 [T] to order or ask sb to come to a certain place 召；唤: Can you call everybody in for lunch? 把他们都叫来吃饭，好吗？ I think we had better call the doctor. 看来我们还是叫医生来好些。
5 [T] to arrange for sth to take place at a certain time 召开: to call a meeting/an election/a strike 召开会议；举行选举；号召罢工
6 [I] call (in/round) (on sb/at...) to make a short visit to a person or place 探访: I called in on Mike on my way home. 我回家路上去探访了迈克。 We called at his house but there was nobody in. 我们去过他的住处，可是没有人在。
7 [I] call at... (used about a train, etc) to stop at the places mentioned （指火车等）靠站，停站: This is the express service to London, calling at Manchester and Birmingham. 这是开往伦敦的快车，中途在曼彻斯特和伯明翰停站。
bring/call sb/sth to mind→MIND¹ call it a day(informal 非正式) to decide to stop doing sth 决定停止做某事；歇工；收工: Let's call it a day. I'm exhausted. 累死啦，我们收工吧。 call sb's bluff to tell sb to actually do what he/she is threatening to do (believing that he/she will not risk doing it) 让某人干他或她扬言要干的事；要某人摊牌 call sb names to use insulting words about sb 谩骂某人 call the shots/tune(informal 非正式) to be in a position to control a situation and make decisions about what should be done 能控制事态和作出决定 call by(informal 非正式) to make a short visit to a place or person as you pass 顺道拜访: I'll call by to pick up the book on my way to work. 我上班的时候可以顺道到你家来取这本书。 call for sb (Brit 英) to collect sb in order to go somewhere together 接走（以便同往某地）: I'll call for you when it's time to go. 到时候我自然会接你走。 call for sth to demand or need sth 要求；需要: The crisis calls for immediate action. 事态严重，要马上采取行动。 This calls for a celebration! 这就该庆贺一下啦！ call sth off to cancel sth 取消: The football match was called off because of the bad weather. 天气恶劣，足球比赛因而取消了。 call sb out to ask sb to come, especially to an emergency 召，唤（尤指去办急事）: We had to call out the doctor in the middle of the night. 我们不得不在半夜急召医生。 call sb up
1 (especially US 尤为美) to telephone sb 给某人打电话: He called me up to tell me the good news. 他打电话把这个好消息告诉我。
2 to order sb to join the army, navy or air force 征召入伍
call sth up to look at sth that is stored in a computer 查看贮存在计算机里的信息: The bank clerk called up my account details on screen. 银行职员在屏幕上查看我账户的详细情况。
*call²
/kɔ:l ||; kɔl/noun
1 (also phone call) [C] an act of telephoning or a conversation on the telephone 打电话；通电话: Were there any calls for me while I was out? 我不在的时候，有人给我来过电话吗？ I'll give you a callat the weekend. 这个周末我会打电话给你。 to make alocal call 打本地电话 a long-distance call 长途电话
2 [C] a loud sound that is made to attract attention; a shout 呼喊: a call for help 呼救 That bird's call is easy to recognize. 那种鸟的叫声容易辨认。
3 [C] a short visit, especially to sb's house 探访: We could pay a call on Dave on our way home. 我们回家路上可以顺便去戴夫那儿坐坐。 The doctor has several calls to make this morning. 今天上午医生要上好几个地方诊病。
4 [C] a request, demand for sth 要求: There have been calls for the President to resign. 要求总统辞职的呼声此起彼落。
5 [C,U] call for sth a need for sth 需求: The doctor said there was no call for concern. 医生说过无须担心。
at sb's beck and call→BECK (be) on call to be ready to work if necessary 随时待命: Dr Young will be on call this weekend. 这个周末由杨医生值班。

ˈcall box
=TELEPHONE BOX

*called
/kɔ:ld ||; kɔld/adj (not before a noun 不用于名词前) to have a particular name 名叫；叫做: His wife is called Silvia. 他的妻子名叫西尔维娅。 I don't know anyone called Alex. 我认识的人当中没有一个叫亚历克斯。

caller
/ˈkɔ:lə(r) ||; ˈkɔlɚ/noun [C] a person who telephones or visits sb 来电话的人；访客

ˌcaller IˈD
noun [U] a telephone service that lets you see who is calling when the telephone rings 来电显示服务

ˈcalling card
noun [C] a card which allows you to make a call from any telephone and later the call is charged to your home telephone number 电话卡﹙持此卡可在任何电话机上打电话，话费转至家庭电话号码﹚

calliper
/ˈkælɪpə(r) ||; ˈkæləpɚ/ (especially US 尤为美 caliper) noun
1 callipers [pl] (mathematics数学) an instrument with two long thin parts joined at one end, used for measuring the DIAMETERof tubes and round objects(= the distance across them) 卡钳；卡尺
2 (US 美 brace) [C] [usu.pl] a metal support for weak or injured legs 双角规形夹（用于支撑无力或受伤的腿）

callous
/ˈkæləs ||; ˈkæləs/adj not caring about the suffering of other people 麻木不仁的；无同情心的

callus
/ˈkæləs ||; ˈkæləs/noun [C] an area of thick hard skin on a hand or foot, usually caused by rubbing 老茧

ˌcall ˈwaiting
noun [U] a telephone service that tells you if sb is trying to call you when you are using the phone 来电候接服务

*calm¹
/kɑ:m;kɑ:lm||; kɑm/adj
1 not excited, worried or angry; quiet 镇静的；冷静的: Try to keep calm -- there's no need to panic. 要冷静，没有什么可惊慌的。 She spoke in a calm voice. 她话说得不慌不忙。 The city is calm again after last night's riots. 昨晚的暴乱过后，市内又恢复了平静。
2 without big waves 浪不大: a calm sea 宁静的大海 [OPP] rough 反义词为 rough
3 without much wind 风不大: calm weather 平静无风的天气 ➔calmly adv ➔calmness noun [U]
calm²
/kɑ:m ||; kɑm/verb [I,T] calm (sb/sth) (down) to become or to make sb quiet or calm （使）平静下来: Calm down! Shouting at everybody won't help. 冷静点！对什么人都乱喊乱叫有什么用！ I did some breathing exercises to calm my nerves. 我做了几次深呼吸以平息紧张的情绪。
calm³
/kɑ:m ||; kɑm/noun [C,U] a period of time or a state when everything is peaceful 宁静；谧静: After living in the city, I enjoyed the calm of country life. 我在城市生活一段时间以后，喜欢上了乡间生活的宁静。

Calor gas™
/ˈkælə gæs ||; ˈkælɚ ˌgæs/noun [U] gas that is kept in special bottles and used for cooking, heating, etc （供煮食、取暖等用的）罐装液化气，卡气

calorie
/ˈkæləri ||; ˈkælərɪ/noun[C]
1 a unit for measuring how much energy food will produce 卡路里，卡（食物的热量单位）: A fried egg contains about 100 calories. 一个煎鸡蛋含有大约100卡热量。 a low-calorie drink/yoghurt/diet 低卡路里饮料╱酸奶╱饮食
2 (technical术语) a unit for measuring a quantity of heat; the amount of heat needed to increase the temperature of a gram of water by one degree Celsius 大卡，千卡（热量单位，一克水升高一摄氏度所需要的热量）

calorific
/ˌkæləˈrɪfɪk ||; ˌkæləˈrɪfɪk/adj (technical术语) connected with or producing heat 与热量或产生热量有关的: the calorific value of food(= the amount of heat or energy produced by a particular amount of food) 食物的热值（一定量的食物所能产生的热量或能量）

calve
/kɑ:v ||; kæv/verb
1 [I] (used about a cow) to give birth to a CALF(= a young cow) （指母牛）生小牛，产犊
2 [I,T] (technical术语) (used about a large piece of ice) to break away from an ICEBERG(= a very large block of ice that floats in the sea) or a GLACIER(= a mass of ice that moves slowly down a valley); to lose a piece of ice in this way （指一大块冰）（从冰山或冰川）崩裂；（冰块因崩裂而）分离 ☞picture at glacial 见 glacial 插图

calves
plural ofCALF

calyx
/ˈkeɪlɪks ||; ˈkelɪks/noun [C] (plural calyxes or calyces /ˈkeɪlɪsi:z ||; ˈkeləˌsiz/) (technical术语) the ring of small green leaves(sepals)that protect a flower before it opens 花萼

CAM
/kæm ||; kæm/abbr computer aided manufacturing 电脑辅助制造；计算机辅助制造

camber
/ˈkæmbə(r) ||; ˈkæmbɚ/noun [C] a slight downward curve from the middle of a road to each side （道路的）中凸形，拱势

camcorder
/ˈkæmkɔ:də(r) ||; ˈkæmˌkɔrdɚ/noun [C] a camera that you can carry around and use for recording pictures and sound on a video cassette （录像兼录音的）手提摄录机

came
past tense ofCOME

camel
/ˈkæml ||; ˈkæmḷ/noun [C] an animal that lives in the desert and has a long neck and either one or two large masses of fat(humps)on its back. It is used for carrying people and goods. 骆驼 ☞Look at dromedary. 参看 dromedary。

cameo
/ˈkæmiəʊ ||; ˈkæmɪˌo/noun [C] (plural cameos)
1 a small part in a film or play that is usually played by a famous actor （电影或戏剧中通常由名演员演的）小角色，客串角色: Sean Connery plays a cameo role as the dying king. 肖恩˙康纳里扮演临死的国王这一小角色。
2 a piece of jewellery that has a design in one colour and a background in a different colour 图案为一色、背景为另一色的珠宝；多彩珠宝

*camera
/ˈkæmərə ||; ˈkæmərə/noun [C] a piece of equipment that you use for taking photographs or moving pictures 照相机；摄像机: I need a new film for my camera. 我的相机要换胶卷了。 a video/television camera 摄像机；电视摄像机

cameraman
/ˈkæmrəmən ||; ˈkæmərəˌmæn/noun [C] (plural -men /-mən ||; -mən/) a person whose job is to operate a camera for a film or a television company （电影或电视的）摄影师 ☞Look at photographer. 参看 photographer。

camouflage
/ˈkæməflɑ:ʒ ||; ˈkæməˌflɑʒ/noun [U]:
1 materials or colours that soldiers use to make themselves and their equipment difficult to see （军事上的）伪装，掩饰
2 the way in which an animal's colour or shape matches its surroundings and makes it difficult to see （动物的）保护色或形状: The polar bear's white fur provides effective camouflage against the snow. 北极熊的白色皮毛在雪地里提供了有效的保护色。 camouflage verb [T]

*camp¹
/kæmp ||; kæmp/noun [C,U] a place where people live in tents or simple buildings away from their usual home 营地: a refugee camp 难民营 The climbers set up camp at the foot of the mountain. 登山运动员在山脚下扎营。
*camp²
/kæmp ||; kæmp/verb [I] camp (out) to sleep without a bed, especially outside in a tent 露营: We camped next to a river. 我们在河边露营。 Go camping is a common way of talking about camping for pleasure They went camping in France last year. 为取乐而露营一般叫go camping：They went camping in France last year.去年他们到法国露营。
campaign¹
/kæmˈpeɪn ||; kæmˈpen/noun[C]
1 a plan to do a number of things in order to achieve a special aim 一连串的行动；运动: to launch an advertising/election campaign 发动一场广告╱竞选运动
2 a planned series of attacks in a war 战役

ˈcamp bed
(US 美 cot) noun [C] a light, narrow bed that you can fold up and carry easily 行军床；折迭床 ☞picture at bed 见 bed 插图
*campaign²
/kæmˈpeɪn ||; kæmˈpen/verb [I] campaign (for/against sb/sth) to take part in a planned series of activities in order to make sth happen or to prevent sth 参与（争取或对抗…的）活动: Local people are campaigning for lower speed limits in the town. 当地人为争取降低镇内车速限制奔走游说。 ➔campaigner noun [C] an animal rights campaigner 争取动物权利运动的参与者

camper
/ˈkæmpə(r) ||; ˈkæmpɚ/noun[C]
1 a person who stays in a tent on holiday 露营者
2 (brit also 英亦作 camper van) a motor vehicle in which you can sleep, cook, etc while on holiday 野营车；露营车

campfire
/ˈkæmpfaɪə(r) ||; ˈkæmpˌfaɪr/noun [C] an outdoor fire made by people who are sleeping outside or living in a tent 营火；篝火

camping
/ˈkæmpɪŋ ||; ˈkæmpɪŋ/noun [U] sleeping or spending a holiday in a tent 露营: Camping is cheaper than staying in hotels. 露营比住旅馆要便宜。 to go on a camping holiday 去露营式度假

campsite
/ˈkæmpsaɪt ||; ˈkæmpsaɪt/noun [C] a place where you can stay in a tent 营地

campus
/ˈkæmpəs ||; ˈkæmpəs/noun [C,U] (plural campuses) the area of land where the main buildings of a college or university are 校园 [C] the college campus 大学校园

*can¹
/kən;strong form kæn ||; kən; kæn/ modal verb (negative cannot /ˈkænɒt ||; ˈkænɑt/short form can't /kɑ:nt; US kænt ||; kænt/ past tense could /kəd ||; kəd/strong form /kʊd ||; kυd/ negative could not short form couldn't /ˈkʊdnt ||; ˈkυdṇt/)
1 used for showing that it is possible for sb/sth to do sth or that sb/sth has the ability to do sth 表示可能性或能力: Can you ride a bike? 你会骑自行车吗？ He can't speak French. 他不会讲法语。
Can has no infinitive or participle forms. To make the future and perfect tenses, we use be able to He's been able to swim for almost a year. Could have is used when we say that somebody had the ability to do something but did not do it She could have passed the exam but she didn't really try. can 没有不定式，也没有分词形式。如要表示将来时及完成时，可用 be able to：He's been able to swim for almost a year.他学会游泳差不多一年了。could have用于表示有能力做某事而没有做：She could have passed the exam but she didn't really try.要是她肯努力，这次考试她早该及格了。
2 used to ask for or give permission （用于提出要求或表示准许）: Can I have a drink, please? 请问有喝的吗？ He asked if he could have a drink. 他问有喝的没有。
When we are talking about general permission in the past could is used I could do anything I wanted when I stayed with my grandma.However, when we are talking about one particular occasion we do not use could They were allowed to visit him in hospital yesterday. 表示过去某段时间内的准许用 could：I could do anything I wanted when I stayed with my grandma.从前我跟外婆住在一起，我做什么都没人管。指某一特定场合不用could：They were allowed to visit him in hospital yesterday.昨天他们获准到医院探望他。
3 used to ask sb to do sth （用于请求某人做某事）: Can you help me carry these books? 你可以帮我拿这些书吗？
4 used for offering to do sth （用于表示愿意做某事）: Can I help at all? 用得着我吗？
For more information about modal verbs, look at the Quick Grammar Reference section at the back of this dictionary. 有关情态动词的详细用法，参看本词典末“语法便览”部份。
5 used to talk about sb's typical behaviour or of a typical effect （用于指特有的行为或效应）: You can be very annoying. 你有时候挺ni4人。 Wasp stings can be very painful. 叫黄蜂蜇着很不好受。
6 used in the negative for saying that you are sure sth is not true （用于否定式，指某事并非属实）: That can't be Maria -- she's in London. 那不可能是玛丽亚呢？她人在伦敦呢。 Surely you can't be hungry. You've only just had lunch. 你肯定不觉得饿。你不是刚吃过午饭吗？
7 used with the verbs ‘feel’, ‘hear’, ‘see’, ‘smell’, ‘taste’ 与feel、hear、see、smell、taste等动词连用
These verbs are not used in the continuous tenses. If we want to talk about seeing, hearing, etc at a particular moment, we use can I can smell something burning.NOT I'm smelling… 这些动词不用于进行时。若指进行中的动作可用 can： I can smell something burning.我闻到什么东西烧着了。不可说I'm smelling…
 *can²
/kæn ||; kæn/noun[C]
1 a metal or plastic container that is used for holding or carrying liquid 金属罐；塑料罐: an oil can 油罐 a watering can 洒水罐
2 a metal container in which food or drink is kept without air so that it stays fresh 罐头: a can of sardines 一罐沙丁鱼 a can of beer 一罐啤酒 ☞picture at container 见 container 插图
In British English we usually use the word tin when it contains food. Can is used for drinks. 在英国英语中，装食物的罐子通常用 tin，盛饮料的罐子用 can。
 can³
/kæn ||; kæn/verb [T] (canning;canned) to put food, drink, etc into a can in order to keep it fresh for a long time 装罐: canned fruit 罐头水果

*canal
/kəˈnæl ||; kəˈnæl/noun[C]
1 a deep cut that is made through land so that boats or ships can travel along it or so that water can flow to an area where it is needed 运河: the Panama Canal 巴拿马运河
2 one of the tubes in the body through which food, air, etc passes （体内输送食物、空气等的）管，道

caˈnal boat
noun [C] a long narrow boat used on canals 运河船（用于运河，船体狭长） ☞picture at boat 见 boat 插图

canary
/kəˈneəri ||; kəˈnɛrɪ/noun [C] (plural canaries) a small yellow bird that sings and is often kept in a cage as a pet 金丝雀

*cancel
/ˈkænsl ||; ˈkænsḷ/verb [T] (cancelling;cancelled (US 美) canceling;canceled)
1 to decide that sth that has been planned or arranged will not happen 取消；撤销: All flights have been cancelled because of the bad weather. 由于天气恶劣，所有航班都取消了。 ☞Look at postpone. 参看 postpone。
2 to stop sth that you asked for or agreed to 收回，撤回（要求、意见等）: to cancel a reservation 撤销预订 I wish to cancel my order for these books. 先前我订了这些书，现在想不要了。
cancel (sth) out to be equal or have an equal effect 抵消；对消: What I owe you is the same as what you owe me, so our debts cancel each other out. 我欠你的数跟你欠我的数一样，这就可以对消了。

cancellation
/ˌkænsəˈleɪʃn ||; ˌkænsḷˈeʃən/noun [C,U] the act of cancelling sth 取消；撤销；撤回: We had to make a last-minute cancellation. 我们不得不在最后时刻撤销了。

cancer
/ˈkænsə(r) ||; ˈkænsɚ/noun
1 [U] [C] a very serious disease in which lumps grow in the body 癌症: She has lung cancer. 她患了肺癌。 He died of cancer. 他死于癌症。
2 [U] Cancer the fourth sign of the ZODIAC, the Crab 黄道第四宫；巨蟹宫；巨蟹星座

cancerous
/ˈkænsərəs ||; ˈkænsərəs/adj (used especially about a part of the body or sth growing in the body) having cancer （尤指身体某部位或体内长的东西）生癌的，患癌症的: a cancerous growth 癌肿瘤 cancerous cells 癌细胞

candid
/ˈkændɪd ||; ˈkændɪd/adj saying exactly what you think 真诚坦率；直言不讳 [SYN] frank 同义词为frank ☞noun candour 名词为 candour ➔candidly adv

candidacy
/ˈkændɪdəsi ||; ˈkændɪdəsɪ/noun [U] being a candidate 候选人身分；候聘人身分

candidate
/ˈkændɪdət; US -deɪt ||; ˈkændɪdet/noun[C]
1 a person who makes a formal request to be considered for a job or wants to be elected to a particular position 应征者；求职者；候选人: We have some very good candidates for the post. 这个职位的应征者有一部份挺不错。
2 a person who is taking an exam 考生

candle
/ˈkændl ||; ˈkændḷ/noun [C] a round stick of solid oil or fat (wax) with a piece of string (a wick) through the middle that you can burn to give light 蜡烛: to light/blow out a candle 点燃╱吹灭蜡烛 ☞picture at light 见light插图

candlelight
/ˈkændllaɪt ||; ˈkændḷˌlaɪt/noun [U] light that comes from a candle 烛光: They had dinner by candlelight. 他们在烛光下共进晚餐。

candlestick
/ˈkændlstɪk ||; ˈkændḷˌstɪk/noun [C] an object for holding a candle or candles 烛台 ☞picture at light 见light插图

candour
/ˈkændə(r) ||; ˈkændɚ/ (US 美 candor) noun [U] the quality of being honest; saying exactly what you think 真诚坦率；直言不讳 ☞adjective candid 形容词为 candid

candy
/ˈkændi ||; ˈkændɪ/noun [C,U] (plural candies) (US 美) =SWEET²(1) You eat too much candy. 你吃糖果吃得太多了。

cane
/keɪn ||; ken/noun
1 [C,U] the long central part of certain plants (bamboo)or(sugar) that is like a tube and is used as a material for making furniture, etc （竹、甘蔗等植物的）茎: sugar cane 甘蔗 a cane chair 藤椅
2 [C] a stick that is used to help sb walk 手杖

canine¹
/ˈkeɪnaɪn ||; ˈkenaɪn/adj connected with dogs 与狗有关；似犬的
canine²
/ˈkeɪnaɪn ||; ˈkenaɪn/ (also canine tooth) noun [C] one of the four pointed teeth in the front of a person's or an animal's mouth 犬齿；犬牙 ☞Look at incisor and molar. 参看 incisor 及 molar。

canister
/ˈkænɪstə(r) ||; ˈkænɪstɚ/noun [C] a small round metal container 金属小圆罐；小圆筒: a gas canister 霰弹筒

cannabis
/ˈkænəbɪs ||; ˈkænəbɪs/noun [U] a drug made from a plant (hemp) that some people smoke for pleasure, but which is illegal in many countries 大麻

cannibal
/ˈkænɪbl ||; ˈkænəbḷ/noun [C] a person who eats other people 食人者 ➔cannibalism /ˈkænɪbəlɪzəm ||; ˈkænəbḷˌɪzəm/ noun [U]

cannon
/ˈkænən ||; ˈkænən/noun [C] (plural cannon or cannons)
1 a large gun on a ship, army vehicle, aircraft, etc （设于船舰、军车、飞机等上面的）火炮，加农炮
2 a large, simple gun that was used in past times for firing large stone or metal balls (cannon balls) 大炮

cannot
/ˈkænɒt ||; ˈkænɑt/ →CAN¹

canoe
/kəˈnu: ||; kəˈnu/noun [C] a light, narrow boat for one or two people that you can move through the water using a flat piece of wood (a paddle) 划艇；独木舟 ☞Look at kayak. 参看 kayak。 ☞picture at boat 见 boat 插图 canoe verb [I] (present participle canoeing third person singular present canoes;past tense past participle canoed) They canoed down the river. 他们划着独木舟顺河而下。 When we are talking about spending time in a canoe it is more usual to say go canoeing We're going canoeing on the river tomorrow. 划独木舟消闲通常叫go canoeing：We're going canoeing on the river tomorrow.明天我们去河上玩独木舟。
canon
/ˈkænən ||; ˈkænən/noun[C]
1 a Christian priest with special duties in a CATHEDRAL(= the largest church in a district) 法政会长（主教座堂的牧师）
2 (formal 正式) a generally accepted rule, standard or principle by which sth is judged 准则；标准；原则: the canons of good taste 衡量高雅趣味的标准
3 a list of books or other works that are generally accepted as the genuine work of a particular writer or as being important 公认的某作家的真作全集: the Shakespeare canon 莎士比亚的真作集
4 a piece of music in which singers or instruments take it in turns to repeat the tune 卡农曲

ˈcan-opener
noun [C] (especially US 尤为美) = tin opener

canopy
/ˈkænəpi ||; ˈkænəpɪ/noun [C] (plural canopies) a cover that hangs or spreads above sth 天篷；罩篷: The highest branches in the rainforest form a dense canopy. 雨林中最高的树枝形成一顶密密的天篷。 a parachute canopy 降落伞形成的罩篷

can't
short forCANNOT

cantaloupe ( also cantaloup)
/ˈkæntəlu:p ||; ˈkæntḷˌop/ (also cantaloupe ˌmelon) noun [C] a type of large fruit (melon) with a green skin and orange flesh 甜瓜；皱皮瓜

canteen
/kænˈti:n ||; kænˈtin/noun [C] the place in a school, factory, office, etc where the people who work there can get meals （学校、工厂、办公室等的）食堂: the staff canteen 职工食堂 ☞Look at cafeteria. 参看 cafeteria。

canter
/ˈkæntə(r) ||; ˈkæntɚ/verb [I] (used about a horse and its rider) to run fairly fast but not very （指马）慢跑；（指骑师）骑马慢跑: We cantered along the beach. 我们骑着马沿海滩慢跑。 canter noun [sing] ☞Look at gallop and trot. 参看 gallop 及 trot。

canvas
/ˈkænvəs ||; ˈkænvəs/noun
1 [U] a type of strong cloth that is used for making sails, bags, tents, etc 帆布
2 [C] a piece of strong cloth for painting a picture on 画布

canvass
/ˈkænvəs ||; ˈkænvəs/verb
1 [I,T] canvass (sb) (for sth) to try to persuade people to vote for a particular person or party in an election or to support sb/sth 拉票；游说: to canvass for votes 拉选票 He's canvassing for the Conservative Party. 他正为保守党拉票。 The Prime Minister is trying to canvass support for the plan. 首相正试图请求支持该项计划。
2 [T] to find out what people's opinions are about sth 调查民意

canyon
/ˈkænjən ||; ˈkænjən/noun [C] a deep valley with very steep sides 峡谷

canyoning
/ˈkænjənɪŋ ||; ˈkænjənɪŋ/ (US 美 canyoneering /ˌkænjəˈnɪrɪŋ ||; ˌkænjə ˈnɪrɪŋ/) noun [U] a sport in which you follow mountain streams into deep valleys (canyons) by climbing down with ropes or by being carried along by the fast-flowing water 溪降运动﹙在峡谷处绕绳下降或被急流‘下﹚

*cap¹
/kæp ||; kæp/noun[C]
1 a soft hat that has a part sticking out at the front (peak) 软帽；鸭舌帽；便帽: a baseball cap 棒球帽 ☞picture at hat 见 hat 插图
2 a soft hat that is worn for a particular purpose 专用帽: a shower cap 淋浴帽
3 a hat that is given to a player who is chosen to play for his/her country （被选入国家运动队的选手戴的）队员帽: He won his first cap against France. 他首次成为国家队队员跟法国比赛。
4 a covering for the end or top of sth 盖；套；罩: Please put the cap back on the bottle. 请把瓶盖盖上。 ☞Look at the note at top ¹. 参看 top^1 的注释。 ☞picture at container 见 container 插图
cap²
/kæp ||; kæp/verb [T] (capping;capped)
1 to cover the top of sth 覆盖: mountains capped with snow 白雪覆盖着的山峰
2 to limit the amount of money that can be spent on sth 给所能花的钱设上限
3 to follow sth with sth bigger or better 胜过；凌驾
4 (sport体育) to choose a player to represent his/her country 推选运动员代表国家
to cap it all as a final piece of bad luck 更甚者: I had a row with my boss, my bike was stolen, and now to cap it all I've lost my keys! 我跟老板吵了一架，自行车又被人偷了，更糟糕的是我现在把钥匙也给丢了！

capability
/ˌkeɪpəˈbɪləti ||; ˌkepəˈbɪlətɪ/noun [C,U] (plural capabilities)capability (to do sth/of doing sth) the quality of being able to do sth 能力: Animals in the zoo have lost the capability to catch/of catching food for themselves. 动物园里的动物已经失去捕食的能力。 I tried to fix the computer, but it was beyond my capabilities. 我想要修理计算机，但这超出了我的能力范围。

*capable
/ˈkeɪpəbl ||; ˈkepəbḷ/adj
1 capable of (doing) sth having the ability or qualities necessary to do sth 有做某事所需的能力或特性: He's capable of passing the exam if he tries harder. 要是他更努力一点，这次考试他准能及格。 That car is capable of 180 miles per hour. 那部汽车时速可达180英里。 I do not believe that she's capable of stealing. 我不信她会偷东西。
2 having a lot of skill; good at doing sth 能干: She's a very capable teacher. 她是个挺能干的老师。 [OPP] incapable 反义词为 incapable ➔capably adv

capacitor
/kəˈpæsɪtə(r) ||; kəˈpæsətɚ/noun [C] (technical术语) a device used to store an electric charge 电容器

capacity
/kəˈpæsəti ||; kəˈpæsətɪ/noun (plural capacities)
1 [sing] [U] the amount that a container or space can hold 容量: The tank has a capacity of 1000 litres. 这罐子的容量可达1000公升。 The stadium was filled to capacity. 运动场座无虚设了。
2 [sing] a capacity (for sth/for doing sth);a capacity (to do sth) the ability to understand or do sth 理解能力；办事能力: That book is beyond the capacity of young children. 那本书超出了幼儿的理解能力。 a capacity for hard work/for learning languages 苦干╱学习语言的能力
3 [C] the official position that sb has 官职；职务: In his capacity aschairman of the council... 他以议会主席的身分…
4 [sing] [U] the amount that a factory or machine can produce 工厂或机器的生产能力: The power station is working at full capacity. 发电站正开足马力发电。

cape
/keɪp ||; kep/noun[C]
1 a piece of clothing with no sleeves that hangs from your shoulders 披肩 ☞Look at cloak. 参看 cloak。
2 a piece of high land that sticks out into the sea 岬角: the Cape of Good Hope 好望角

capillary
/kəˈpɪləri ||; ˈkæpḷˌɛrɪ/noun [C] (plural capillaries) any of the smallest tubes in the body that carry blood 毛细管

*capital¹
/ˈkæpɪtl ||; ˈkæpətḷ/noun
1 (also capital city) [C] the town or city where the government of a country is 首都: Madrid is the capital of Spain. 马德里是西班牙的首都。
2 [U] an amount of money that you use to start a business or to put in a bank, etc so that you earn more money (interest) on it 资金，资本（可用以赚取利润）: When she had enough capital, she bought a shop. 她等到资金充足的时候，便买下一家商店。
3 (also capital letter) [C] the large form of a letter of the alphabet 大写字母；大写字体: Write your name in capitals. 用大写字母写上你的姓名。
4 [C] a place that is well known for a particular thing 在某方面出名的地方；…之都: Niagara Falls is the honeymoon capital of the world. 尼亚加拉瀑布是世界的蜜月之都。
capital²
/ˈkæpɪtl ||; ˈkæpətḷ/adj
1 connected with punishment by death 与死刑有关的: a capital offence (= a crime for which sb can be sentenced to death) 死罪
2 (used about letters of the alphabet) written in the large form （指字母）大写的: ‘David’ begins with a capital ‘D’. David以字母D开头。

ˌcapital ˈgains
noun [pl] profits that you make from selling sth, especially property 资本收益（尤指财产）: to pay capital gains tax 缴资本收益税

ˌcapital inˈvestment
noun [U] money that a business spends on buildings, equipment, etc 资本投入，资本投资（公司花在楼房、设备等方面的资金）

capitalism
/ˈkæpɪtəlɪzəm ||; ˈkæpətḷˌɪzəm/noun [U] the economic system in which businesses are owned and run for profit by individuals and not by the state 资本主义（制度） ☞Look at communism, Marxism and socialism. 参看 communism、Marxism 及 socialism。 ➔capitalist noun [C] adj

capitalize
/ˈkæpɪtəlaɪz ||; ˈkæpətḷˌaɪz/ (also -ise) verb [T]
1 to write or print a letter of the alphabet as aCAPITAL; to begin a word with a capital letter 将某字母大写；将某词的首字母大写
2 (technical术语) to sell possessions in order to change them into money 出售财产（使其变成钱）
3 (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) (technical术语) to provide a company etc with the money it needs to function （为公司等）提供运转所需的钱，提供资本 ➔capitalization(also -isation) /ˌkæpɪtəlaɪˈzeɪʃn ||; ˌkæpətḷaɪˈzeʃən/ noun [U]
capitalize on sth to use sth to your advantage 乘机利用: We can capitalize on the mistakes that our rivals have made. 我们可以利用对手所犯的错误。

ˌcapital ˈpunishment
noun [U] punishment by death for serious crimes 死刑 ☞Look at death penalty and compare corporal punishment. 参看 death penalty，与 corporal punishment 比较。

capitulate
/kəˈpɪtʃuleɪt ||; kəˈpɪtʃəˌlet/verb [I] (formal 正式) to stop fighting and accept that you have lost; to give in to sb 投降；屈从 ➔capitulation /kəˌpɪtjuˈleɪʃn ||; kəˌpɪtʃəˈleʃən/ noun [C,U]

cappuccino
/ˌkæpuˈtʃi:nəʊ ||; ˌkæpəˈtʃino/noun
1 [U] a type of coffee made with milk which has been heated with steam so that it has bubbles (foam) and sometimes chocolate powder on the top 卡布奇诺咖啡
2 [C] (plural cappuccinos) a cup of cappuccino 一杯卡布奇诺咖啡

capricious
/kəˈprɪʃəs ||; kəˈprɪʃəs/adj changing behaviour suddenly in a way that is difficult to predict 变化无常的；变幻莫测的: a capricious actor 任性的演员

Capricorn
/ˈkæprɪkɔ:n ||; ˈkæprɪˌkɔrn/noun [U] the tenth sign of the ZODIAC, the Goat 黄道第十宫；摩羯宫；摩羯星座

capsicum
/ˈkæpsɪkəm ||; ˈkæpsɪkəm/noun [C] a type of pepper which may be green, yellow or red and can be eaten cooked or not cooked 辣椒

capsize
/kæpˈsaɪz; US ˈkæpsaɪz ||; ˈkæpˌsaɪz/verb [I,T] (used about boats) to turn over in the water （指小船）倾覆，翻: The canoe capsized. 独木舟翻了。 A big wave capsized the yacht. 大浪倾覆了游艇。

capsule
/ˈkæpsju:l; US kæpsl ||; kæpsḷ/noun[C]
1 a very small closed tube of medicine that you swallow （内含药物的）胶囊药 ☞picture at health 见health插图
2 a container that is closed so that air, water, etc cannot enter 密封舱

Capt.
abbr Captain; a position (rank) in the British and American armies （英国和美国陆军中的）上尉

*captain¹
/ˈkæptɪn ||; ˈkæptɪn/noun[C]
1 the person who is in command of a ship or an aircraft 船长；机长
2 a person who is the leader of a group or team 队长；首领: Who's (the) captain of the French team? 谁是法国队的队长？
3 an officer at a middle level in the army or navy 陆军上尉；海军上校
captain²
/ˈkæptɪn ||; ˈkæptɪn/verb [T] to be the captain of a group or team 当队长；当首领

caption
/ˈkæpʃn ||; ˈkæpʃən/noun [C] the words that are written above or below a picture, photograph, etc to explain what it is about （图片、照片等的）说明文字

captivate
/ˈkæptɪveɪt ||; ˈkæptəˌvet/verb [T] to attract and hold sb's attention 迷住；（深深）吸引 ➔captivating adj

captive¹
/ˈkæptɪv ||; ˈkæptɪv/adj kept as a prisoner; (used about animals) kept in a cage, etc 被俘虏；（动物）困在笼中 (figurative 比喻) a captive audience (= listening because they cannot leave) 脱不了身的听众 hold sb captive to keep sb as a prisoner and not allow him/her to escape 囚禁 take sb captive to catch sb and hold him/her as your prisoner 俘虏 It is also possible to say hold sb prisoner and take sb prisoner. 也可以说 hold sb prisoner 和 take sb prisoner。
captive²
/ˈkæptɪv ||; ˈkæptɪv/noun [C] a prisoner 囚犯；俘虏

captivity
/kæpˈtɪvəti ||; kæpˈtɪvətɪ/noun [U] the state of being kept in a place that you cannot escape from 禁锢: Wild animals are often unhappy in captivity. 一般说来，囚在笼中的野生动物都不开心。

captor
/ˈkæptə(r) ||; ˈkæptɚ/noun [C] a person who takes or keeps a person as a prisoner 俘虏者；禁锢者

capture¹
/ˈkæptʃə(r) ||; ˈkæptʃɚ/verb[T]
1 to take a person or animal prisoner 虏获；擒获: The lion was captured and taken back to the zoo. 狮子被捉回动物园。
2 to take control of sth 夺取；攻占: The town has been captured by the rebels. 这个镇已被叛军攻陷。 The company has captured 90% of the market. 这家公司已经占有90%的市场。
3 to make sb interested in sth 迷住；引起兴趣: The story captured the children's imagination. 这故事唤起了孩子们的想象／兴趣／注意
4 to succeed in representing or recording sth in words, pictures, etc （以文字、图片等）代表，记录: This poem captures the atmosphere of the carnival. 这首诗掌握了嘉年华会的气氛。 The robbery was captured on video. 这次抢劫案被录了下来。
5 (computing计算机技术) to put sth into a computer in a form that it can use 将…以可使用的形式输入计算机；捕获
capture²
/ˈkæptʃə(r) ||; ˈkæptʃɚ/noun [U] the act of capturing sth or being captured 捕捉或被捕捉: data capture 数据记录

*car
/kɑ:(r) ||; kɑr/noun[C]
1 (especially US 尤为美 automobile) a road vehicle with four wheels that can carry a small number of people 汽车: a new/second-hand car 一辆新车╱二手车（旧车） Where can I park the car? 我可以在哪里停放车子？ They had a car crash. 他们撞了车。 to get into/out of a car 上车；下车
We go in the car or by car. You can also use the verb drive I come to work in the car/by car. I drive to work. 乘车去叫做go in the car或go by car，也可以叫drive：I come to work in the car／by car.我是开车上班的。·I drive to work.我是开车上班的。
2 (Brit 英) a section of a train that is used for a particular purpose （作特定用途的）火车车厢: a dining/sleeping car 餐车；卧车
3 (US 美) =CARRIAGE(1)

carafe
/kəˈræf ||; kəˈræf/noun [C] a glass container like a bottle with a wide neck, in which wine or water is served （大瓶颈的）玻璃饮料瓶 ☞picture at jug 见 jug 插图

caramel
/ˈkærəmel ||; ˈkærəmḷ/noun
1 [U] burnt sugar that is used to add flavour and colour to food 焦糖
2 [C,U] a type of sticky sweet that is made from boiled sugar, butter and milk 焦糖味的牛奶糖果

carapace
/ˈkærəpeɪs ||; ˈkærəˌpes/noun [C] (technical术语) the hard shell on the back of some animals, for example CRABS, that protects them （蟹等动物的）背甲，硬壳

carat
/ˈkærət ||; ˈkærət/ (US 美 karat) noun [C] a unit for measuring how pure gold is or how heavy jewels are 开（黄金纯度单位）；克拉（宝石重量单位）: a 20-carat gold ring 20开金戒指

*caravan
/ˈkærəvæn ||; ˈkærəˌvæn/noun[C]
1 (US 美 trailer) a large vehicle that is pulled by a car. You can sleep, cook, etc in a caravan when you are travelling or on holiday. 野营车（用汽车拖曳的大型车辆，饮食起居均在车内，用于旅行或度假）
When we are talking about using a caravan for holidays we say go caravanning. 在野营车度假叫做 go caravanning。
2 a group of people and animals that travel together, for example across a desert 沙漠旅行队

carbohydrate
/ˌkɑ:bəʊˈhaɪdreɪt ||; ˌkɑrboˈhaɪdret/noun [C,U] one of the substances in food, for example sugar, that gives your body energy 碳水化合物；糖类: Athletes need a diet that is high in carbohydrate. 运动员需要含丰富碳水化合物的食物。 Bread, potatoes and rice all contain carbohydrates. 面包、马铃薯、米饭都含有碳水化合物。

carbon
/ˈkɑ:bən ||; ˈkɑrbən/noun [U] (symbol C) a chemical substance that is found in all living things, and also in diamonds, coal, petrol, etc 碳

carbonate
/ˈkɑ:bənət ||; ˈkɑrbəˌnet/noun [C] (symbol CO₃) a salt that is often formed by the reaction of CARBON DIOXIDE (= a gas that people and animals breathe out of their lungs) with another chemical substance 碳酸盐

ˌcarbon ˈcopy
noun [C]
1 a copy of a letter, etc that was made using special paper(carbon paper) 复写本；副本
2 an exact copy of sth 一模一样的东西

ˌcarbon ˈdating
noun [U] a method of calculating the age of very old objects by measuring the amounts of different forms of CARBON (= a chemical substance that is found in all living things) in them 碳定年法

ˌcarbon diˈoxide
noun [U] (symbol CO₂) a gas that has no colour or smell that people and animals breathe out of their lungs 二氧化碳

carbonic acid
/kɑ:ˌbɒnɪk ˈæsɪd ||; kɑrˈbɑnɪk ˈæsɪd/noun [U] a very weak acid that is formed when CARBON DIOXIDE (= a gas that people and animals breathe out of their lungs) dissolves in water 碳酸

carboniferous
/ˌkɑ:bəˈnɪfərəs ||; ˌkɑrbəˈnɪfərəs/adj (in geology 地质学)
1 producing or containing coal 产煤的；含煤的
2 Carboniferous of the period in the earth's history when layers of coal were formed underground 石炭纪的

carbon monoxide
/ˌkɑ:bən məˈnɒksaɪd/noun [U] (symbol CO) a poisonous gas formed when CARBONburns partly but not completely. It is produced when petrol is burnt in car engines. 一氧化碳

ˈcarbon paper
noun [U] thin paper with a dark substance on one side that you put between two sheets of paper to make a copy of what you are writing 复写纸

ˌcar ˈboot sale
noun [C] an outdoor sale where people sell things they do not want from the back of their cars 车尾旧物拍卖（人们把不要的旧货放在汽车行李箱里出售）

carburettor
/ˌkɑ:bəˈretə(r) ||; ˈkɑrbjəˌrɛtɚ/ (US 美 carburetor) noun [C] the piece of equipment in a car's engine that mixes petrol and air （汽车引擎内的）汽化器，化油器

carcass
/ˈkɑ:kəs ||; ˈkɑrkəs/noun [C] the dead body of an animal （动物的）尸体 ☞Look at corpse. 参看 corpse。

carcinogen
/kɑ:ˈsɪnədʒən ||; kɑrˈsɪnədʒən/noun [C] a substance that can cause CANCER(= a very serious disease in which lumps grow in the body) 致癌物质

carcinogenic
/ˌkɑ:sɪnəˈdʒenɪk ||; ˌkɑrsənəˈdʒɛnɪk/adj likely to cause CANCER 致癌的

*card
/kɑ:d ||; kɑrd/noun
1 [U] thick rigid paper 厚纸片；薄纸板
2 [C] a piece of card or plastic that has information on it 卡片: Here is my business card in case you need to contact me. 这是我的名片，万一你需要跟我联系。 a membership/identity/credit card 会员证；身分证；信用卡
3 [C] a piece of card with a picture on it that you use for sending a special message to sb 贺卡；问候卡: a Christmas/birthday card 圣诞卡；生日卡 a get-well card (= one that you send to sb who is ill) 康复卡
4 (also playing card) [C] one of a set of 52 small pieces of card with shapes or pictures on them that are used for playing games 纸牌；扑克牌: a pack of cards 一副纸牌
5 cards [pl] games that are played with cards 纸牌戏: Let's play cards. 我们玩牌吧。 Let's have a game of cards. 我们玩一局牌吧。 I never win at cards! 我玩纸牌从没赢过！
A pack of cards is divided into four suits, two red (hearts and diamonds) and two black (clubs and spades). Each suit has an ace, a king, a queen, a jack and nine other cards, numbered from 2 to 10. Before we play cards we shuffle, cut and deal the cards. 一副纸牌(a pack of cards)分为四组花色(suit)，两组红（一组红心(heart)，一组方块(diamond)），两组黑（一组梅花(club)，一组黑桃(spade)）。每组有爱司(ace)、老Ｋ(king)、王后(queen)、杰克(jack)跟九张由2到10的牌。玩牌之前要洗牌(shuffle)、切牌(cut)和发牌(deal)。 ☞picture at sport 见sport插图 on the cards (US 美) ;in the cards(informal 非正式) likely to happen 可能发生: Their marriage break-up has been on the cards for some time now. 他们的婚姻存在破裂的可能性已经有一段时间了。

*cardboard
/ˈkɑ:dbɔ:d ||; ˈkɑrdˌbɔrd/noun [U] very thick paper that is used for making boxes, etc 卡纸板；薄纸板；硬纸板: The goods were packed in cardboard boxes. 货物装在纸板箱里。

ˈcard catalog
(US 美) =CARD INDEX

cardholder
/ˈkɑ:dhəʊldə(r) ||; ˈkɑrdˌholdɚ/noun [C] a person who uses a card from a bank, etc to pay for things （信用卡）持卡人

cardiac
/ˈkɑ:diæk ||; ˈkɑrdɪˌæk/adj (formal 正式) connected with the heart 与心脏有关的: cardiac surgery 心脏手术 a cardiac arrest (= when the heart stops temporarily or permanently) 心脏停跳；心跳停止

ˌcardiac arˈrest
noun [C] (medical医学) a serious medical condition when the heart stops working 心脏停跳；心搏停止

cardigan
/ˈkɑ:dɪgən ||; ˈkɑrdɪgən/noun [C] a piece of clothing like a woollen jacket, that fastens at the front （前面系扣的）卡迪根式毛衣；开襟毛线衣 ☞picture on page C6 见C6页插图 ☞Look at the note at sweater. 参看 sweater 的注释。

cardinal
/ˈkɑ:dɪnl ||; ˈkɑrdṇəl/noun[C]
1 a priest at a high level in the Roman Catholic church （罗马天主教会的）红衣主教，枢机主教
2 (also ˌcardinal ˈnumber) a whole number, for example 1, 2, 3, that shows quantity 基数 ☞Look at ordinal. 参看 ordinal。

ˌcardinal ˈpoints
noun [pl] (technical术语) the four main points (North, South, East and West) on an instrument that shows direction(a compass) （罗盘上的）方位基点（即北、南、东及西）

ˈcard index
(also index) (US 美 card catalog) noun [C] a box of cards with information on them, arranged in the order of the alphabet 卡片索引；卡片目录 ☞picture at stationery 见 stationery 插图

cardio-
/ˈkɑ:diəʊ ||; ˈkɑrdɪo/prefix (in nouns, adjectives and adverbs 用于构成名词、形容词及副词) connected with the heart 与心脏有关

*care¹
/keə(r) ||; kɛr/noun
1 [U] care (for sb) looking after sb/sth so that he/she/it has what he/she/it needs for his/her/its health and protection 照顾；照料: All the children in their care were healthy and happy. 他们照顾的孩子全都又健康又快乐。 This hospital provides free medical care. 这家医院提供免费医疗。 She's in intensive care (= the part of the hospital for people who are very seriously ill). 她正接受特别护理。 skin/hair care products 护肤品；护发品
2 [U] care (over sth/in doing sth) thinking about what you are doing so that you do it well or do not make a mistake 留神；用心: You should take more careover your homework. 你做功课要多用点心。 This box contains glasses -- please handle it with care. 这个箱子装着玻璃杯，请小心轻放。
3 [C,U] something that makes you feel worried or unhappy 担心的事；不快的事；忧虑: Since Charlie retired he doesn't have a care in the world. 查利退休以后过着无忧无虑的生活。 It was a happy life, free from care. 那段日子很快乐，无忧亦无虑。
in care (used about children) living in a home which is organized by the government or the local council, and not with their parents （指孩子）住在由政府或地方当局设立的儿童之家: They were taken into care after their parents died. 父母死后，他们由儿童之家收留。 take care (that.../to do sth) to be careful 小心: Goodbye and take care! 再见了，请多保重！ Take care that you don't spill your tea. 当心，别把茶泼出来。 He took care not to arrive too early. 他特意不过早到达。 take care of sb/sth to deal with sb/sth; to organize or arrange sth 处理；筹备；安排: I'll take care of the food for the party. 酒会的食物由我来安排吧。 take care of yourself/sb/sth to keep yourself/sb/sth safe from injury, illness, damage, etc; to look after sb/sth 照顾: My mother took care of me when I was ill. 我生病的时候由我母亲照顾我。 She always takes great care of her books. 她总是很爱惜她的书。
*care²
/keə(r) ||; kɛr/verb [I,T] care (about sb/sth) to be worried about or interested in sb/sth 担心；关心；介意: Money is the thing that she cares about most. 她最在乎的就是钱。 He really cares about his staff. 他确实很关心他的员工。 I don't care what you do. 我不在乎你干什么。 I, etc couldn't care less(informal 非正式) it does not matter to me, etc at all 毫不在乎: I couldn't care less what Barry thinks. 巴里怎么想我都毫不在乎。 who cares?(informal 非正式) nobody is interested; it is not important to anyone 没人在乎: ‘I wonder who'll win the match.’ ‘Who cares?’ “我在想谁会赢得比赛。”“管它呢！” would you care for.../to do sth(formal 正式) a polite way to ask if sb would like sth or would like to do sth （用以客气地询问某人是否想要什么或愿意做什么） care for sb to look after sb 照顾: Who cared for her while she was ill? 她生病时是谁照顾她的？ care for sb/sth to like or love sb/sth 喜欢；爱: She still cares for Liam although he married someone else. 尽管利亚姆已经跟别人结婚，她仍然爱着他。 I don't care for that colour very much. 我不大喜欢那种颜色。

*career¹
/kəˈrɪə(r) ||; kəˈrɪr/noun[C]
1 the series of jobs that sb has in a particular area of work 职业；事业: Sarah is considering a career in engineering. 萨拉想当工程师。 a successful career in politics 政坛得意
2 the period of your life that you spend working 职业生涯: She spent most of her career working in India. 她的职业生涯大部份都在印度度过。
career²
/kəˈrɪə(r) ||; kəˈrɪr/verb [I] to move quickly and in a dangerous way 莽撞: The car careered off the road and crashed into a wall. 汽车冲出了马路，撞到一堵墙。

carefree
/ˈkeəfri: ||; ˈkɛrˌfri/adj with no problems or worries 无忧无虑

*careful
/ˈkeəfl ||; ˈkɛrfəl/adj
1 careful (of/with sth);careful (to do sth) thinking about what you are doing so that you do not have an accident or make mistakes, etc 小心: Be careful ! There's a car coming. 小心，有车开过来了！ Please be very careful of the traffic. 请千万要当心来往车辆。 Be careful with that knife -- it's very sharp. 那把刀子很锋利，当心点呀。 That ladder doesn't look very safe. Be careful you don't fall. 那把梯子看来不很安全，小心别摔倒。 I was careful not to say anything about the money. 我把话说得很小心，跟那笔钱有关的都绝口不提。 a careful driver 小心开车的司机
2 giving a lot of attention to details to be sure sth is right 细心: I'll need to give this matter some careful thought. 我要把这个问题仔细想一想。 a careful worker 细心的工人 ➔carefully /ˈkeəfəli ||; ˈkɛrfəlɪ/ adv Please listen carefully. It's important that you remember all this. 请留心听，你得记住这些事情。

*careless
/ˈkeələs ||; ˈkɛrlɪs/adj
1 careless (about/with sth) not thinking enough about what you are doing so that you make mistakes 粗心: Jo's very careless. 乔很粗心。 The accident was caused by careless driving. 这次意外是鲁莽驾驶所致。
2 resulting from a lack of thought or attention to detail 疏忽引起的: a careless mistake 疏忽造成的错误 ➔carelessly adv She threw her coat carelessly on the chair. 她把外套随便扔在椅子上。 ➔carelessness noun [U]

carer
/ˈkeərə(r) ||; ˈkɛrɚ/ (US 美 caregiver /ˈkeəgɪvə(r) ||; ˈkɛrgɪvɚ/) noun [C] a person who regularly looks after sb who is unable to look after himself/herself because of age, illness, etc （为因年老、生病等而生活无法自理者）提供照顾的人

caress
/kəˈres ||; kəˈrɛs/verb [T] to touch sb/sth in a gentle and loving way 爱抚；抚摸 caress noun [C]

caretaker
/ˈkeəteɪkə(r) ||; ˈkɛrˌtekɚ/ (US 美 janitor) noun [C] a person whose job is to look after a large building, for example a school or a block of flats （学校、公寓等的）看门人

*cargo
/ˈkɑ:gəʊ ||; ˈkɑrgo/noun [C,U] (plural cargoes (US also 美亦作) cargos) the goods that are carried in a ship or an aircraft （船或飞机上的）货物: Luggage is carried in the cargo hold of the plane. 行李放在飞机的货舱里托运。 a cargo ship 货轮；货船

ˈcargo pants
noun [pl] loose-fitting informal trousers with many pockets, including some on the side of the legs 工装裤﹙多口袋、宽松﹚

caricature
/ˈkærɪkətʃʊə(r) ||; ˈkærɪkətʃɚ/noun [C] a picture or description of sb that makes his/her appearance or behaviour funnier and more extreme than it really is 漫画，讽刺文字（把某人的容颜或行为作夸张描绘）: Many of the people in the book are caricatures of the author's friends. 书中的人物有许多是作者对朋友的夸张描绘。

caring
/ˈkeərɪŋ ||; ˈkɛrɪŋ/adj showing that you care about other people 对别人关心的: We must work towards a more caring society. 我们必须努力建立一个较有爱心的社会。

carjacking
/ˈkɑ:dʒækɪŋ ||; ˈkɑrˌdʒækɪŋ/noun [C,U] the crime of taking control of sb's car or forcing him/her to give you his/her car, especially using a gun or other weapon 劫持汽车﹙罪﹚ ➔carjack verb [T] ➔carjacker noun [C]

carnage
/ˈkɑ:nɪdʒ ||; ˈkɑrnɪdʒ/noun [U] (written 书面语) the violent killing of a large number of people 大屠杀

carnation
/kɑ:ˈneɪʃn ||; kɑrˈneʃən/noun [C] a white, pink or red flower with a pleasant smell 康乃馨 ☞picture on page C2 见C2页插图

carnival
/ˈkɑ:nɪvl ||; ˈkɑrnəvḷ/noun [C] a public festival that takes place in the streets with music and dancing 嘉年华会；狂欢节: the carnival in Rio 里约热内卢狂欢节

carnivore
/ˈkɑ:nɪvɔ:(r) ||; ˈkɑrnəˌvɔr/noun [C] any animal that eats meat 食肉动物 ☞Look at herbivore, insectivore and omnivore. 参看 herbivore、insectivore 及 omnivore。 ➔carnivorous /kɑ:ˈnɪvərəs ||; kɑrˈnɪvərəs/ adj Lions are carnivorous animals. 狮子是食肉动物。

carol
/ˈkærəl ||; ˈkærəl/noun [C] a Christian religious song that people sing at Christmas 圣诞颂歌

carotid artery
/kəˈrɒtɪd ɑ:təri ||; kəˈrɑtɪd ˈɑrtərɪ/noun [C] either of the two large tubes in your neck(arteries)that carry blood to your head 颈动脉

carousel
/ˌkærəˈsel ||; ˌkærəˈsɛl/noun[C]
1 (US 美) =MERRY-GO-ROUND
2 a moving belt at an airport that carries luggage for passengers to collect （机场的）行李输送带

carp
/kɑ:p ||; kɑrp/noun [C,U] (plural carp) a large fish that lives in lakes and rivers 鲤鱼

carpal
/ˈkɑ:pl ||; ˈkɑrpḷ/noun [C] any of the eight small bones in the wrist 腕骨

ˈcar park
(US 美 parking lot) noun [C] an area or a building where you can leave your car 停车场: a multi-storey car park 多层停车场

carpel
/ˈkɑ:pl ||; ˈkɑrpḷ/noun [C] the female REPRODUCTIVEorgan of a flower 心皮（花的雌性生殖器） ☞picture at flower 见 flower 插图

carpenter
/ˈkɑ:pəntə(r) ||; ˈkɑrpəntɚ/noun [C] a person whose job is to make things from wood 木匠 ☞Look at joiner. 参看 joiner。

carpentry
/ˈkɑ:pəntri ||; ˈkɑrpəntrɪ/noun [U] the skill or work of a carpenter 木工手艺；木工艺品

*carpet
/ˈkɑ:pɪt ||; ˈkɑrpɪt/noun
1 [C,U] (a piece of) thick material that is used for covering floors and stairs 地毯: a fitted carpet (= one that is cut to the exact shape of a room) 完全照房间形状剪裁的地毯 a square metre of carpet 一平方米地毯 ☞Look at rug. 参看 rug。
2 [C] a thick layer of sth that covers the ground 积在地面厚厚的一层物质: The fields were under a carpet of snow. 田野积了厚厚的白雪。 ➔carpeted adj All the rooms are carpeted. 全部房间都铺上了地毯。

ˈcar pool
noun [C] an arrangement where several people travel together to work, school, etc in one car and usually share the costs of traveling 合伙用车﹙一组人共乘一辆车上班、上学等，各人分摊开支﹚ ➔carpool verb [I]: There would be less traffic if more people carpooled and used public transportation. 假如更多的人能合伙用车和使用公共交通，那么交通量就会减少。

carport
/ˈkɑ:pɔ:t ||; ˈkɑrˌpɔrt/noun [C] a shelter for a car that is made of a roof supported by posts and which is often built beside or against the side of a house ﹙屋侧的﹚汽车棚 ☞ Look at garage. 参看 garage。

carriage
/ˈkærɪdʒ ||; ˈkærɪdʒ/noun[C]
1 (also coach) (US 美 car) one of the separate parts of a train where people sit （火车）客车厢: a first-class carriage 头等车厢
2 (also coach) a vehicle with wheels that is pulled by horses 马车

carriageway
/ˈkærɪdʒweɪ ||; ˈkærɪdʒˌwe/noun [C] (Brit 英) one of the two sides of a motorway or main road on which vehicles travel in one direction only 车道: the southbound carriageway of the motorway 高速公路上的南行车道 ☞Look at dual carriageway. 参看 dual carriageway。

carrier
/ˈkæriə(r) ||; ˈkærɪɚ/noun[C]
1 (in business) a company that transports people or goods （商业）运输公司: the Dutch carrier, KLM 荷兰航空公司 KLM
2 a military vehicle or ship that is used for transporting soldiers, planes, weapons, etc （军事上的）运输工具: an aircraft carrier 航空母舰
3 a person or animal that can give an infectious disease to others but does not show the signs of the disease 带菌者；携带病毒者: Some insects are carriers of tropical diseases. 某几类昆虫是热带疾病的媒介。
4 (Brit 英) =CARRIER BAG

ˈcarrier bag
(brit also 英亦作 carrier) noun [C] a plastic or paper bag for carrying shopping 购物袋 ☞picture at bag 见bag插图

carrion
/ˈkæriən ||; ˈkærɪən/noun [U] the flesh of an animal that has been dead for some time （动物尸体的）腐肉 ☞picture at bird of prey 见 bird of prey 插图

carrot
/ˈkærət ||; ˈkærət/noun
1 [C,U] a long thin orange vegetable that grows under the ground 胡萝卜: A pound of carrots, please. 请给我一磅胡萝卜。 grated carrot 胡萝卜丝 ☞picture on page C3 见C3页插图
2 [C] something attractive that is offered to sb in order to persuade him/her to do sth （用作利诱的）报酬，好处

*carry
/ˈkæri ||; ˈkærɪ/verb (present participle carrying third person singular present carries;past tense past participle carried)
1 [T] to hold sb/sth in your hand, arms or on your back while you are moving from one place to another 搬；携带: Could you carry this bag for me? It's terribly heavy. 这个袋子怪重的，可不可以帮我搬一下？ She was carrying a rucksack on her back. 她背着一个帆布背包。 You use wear, not carry, to talk about having clothes, jewellery, etc on your body He was wearing a black jacket. 穿衣服、戴首饰等，用wear而不用carry：He was wearing a black jacket.他穿着一件黑色夹克。
2 [T] to have sth with you as you go somewhere 捎；带: I never carry much money with me when I go to London. 每次到伦敦去我都不带太多钱。 Do the police carry guns in your country? 你们国家的警察带枪吗？
3 [T] to transport sb/sth from one place to another 运送: A train carrying hundreds of passengers crashed yesterday. 昨天一列载有好几百名旅客的火车失事撞毁了。 Strong winds carried the boat off course. 大风把小船刮得偏离航向。
4 [T] to have an infectious disease that can be given to others, usually without showing any signs of the disease yourself 带菌；带病毒
5 [T] (usually passive 通常用于被动语态) to officially approve of sth in a meeting, etc, because the largest number of people vote for it 经表决通过: The motion was carried by 12 votes to 9. 动议以12票对9票通过。
6 [I] (used about a sound) to reach a long distance （指声音）传开: You'll have to speak louder if you want your voice to carry to the back of the room. 要是你想让房间后面的人听清楚你说的话，就得大声一点。
be/get carried away to be so excited that you forget what you are doing （激动得）忘乎所以，不能自已 carry weight to have influence on the opinion of sb else 左右（某人的意见）: Nick's views carry a lot of weight with the boss. 老板很重视尼克的意见。 carry it/sth off to succeed in doing sth difficult 克服困难: He felt nervous before he started his speech but he carried it off very well. 他演说之前很紧张，但最后顺利完成了演讲。 carry on (with sth/doing sth) to continue 继续: They ignored me and carried on with their conversation. 他们理也不理我，只顾谈下去。 She intends to carry on studying after the course has finished. 这个课程结束后，她打算继续进修。 carry on sth to do an activity 从事；经营: to carry on a conversation/a business 进行谈话；做生意 carry out sth
1 to do sth that you have been ordered to do 执行: The soldiers carried out their orders without question. 那些士兵都无异议地执行命令。
2 to do a task, repair, etc 执行（任务）；进行（维修）: to carry out tests/an investigation 进行试验╱调查

carrycot
/ˈkærikɒt ||; ˈkærɪˌkɑt/noun [C] a small bed, like a box with handles, that you can carry a baby in 手提式婴儿床 ☞picture at pram 见 pram 插图

ˈcarry-on
noun [C] (especially US 尤为美) a small piece of luggage that you can take onto a plane with you 可随身带上飞机的小件行李；手提行李；随身行李

ˈcarry-out
(US 美) =TAKEAWAY

ˈcar seat
noun [C]
1 a special safety seat for a child to use when riding in a car ﹙可放在汽车中的﹚儿童安全座椅
2 a seat in a car 汽车座位

carsick
/ˈkɑ:sɪk ||; ˈkɑrˌsɪk/adj feeling sick or vomiting as a result of travelling in a car 晕车: to get/feel/be carsick 感到晕车 ☞Look at airsick, seasick and travel-sick. 参看 airsick、seasick 及 travel-sick。

cart¹
/kɑ:t ||; kɑrt/noun [C] a vehicle with wheels that is used for transporting things 大车；手推车
cart²
/kɑ:t ||; kɑrt/verb [T] (informal 非正式) to take or carry sth/sb somewhere, often with difficulty 吃力地运送: We left our luggage at the station because we didn't want to cart it around all day. 我们把行李寄存在车站，免得整天带着到处走。

cartel
/kɑ:ˈtel ||; kɑrˈtɛl/noun [C] [with.sop] a group of separate companies that agree to increase profits by fixing prices and not competing with each other 卡特尔；公司联合

cartilage
/ˈkɑ:tɪlɪdʒ ||; ˈkɑrtḷɪdʒ/noun [C,U] a strong substance in the places where your bones join 软骨 ☞picture at synovial 见 synovial 插图

cartographer
/kɑ:ˈtɒgrəfə(r) ||; kɑrˈtɑgrəfɚ/noun [C] a person who draws or makes maps 地图绘制员

cartography
/kɑ:ˈtɒgrəfi ||; kɑrˈtɑgrəfɪ/noun [U] the art or process of drawing or making maps 地图绘制 ➔cartographic /ˌkɑ:təˈgræfɪk ||; ˌkɑrtəˈgræfɪk/ adj

carton
/ˈkɑ:tn ||; ˈkɑrtṇ/noun [C] a small container made of cardboard or plastic 纸板盒；塑料盒: a carton of milk/orange juice 一盒牛奶╱橙汁 ☞picture at container 见 container 插图

cartoon
/kɑ:ˈtu:n ||; kɑrˈtun/noun[C]
1 a funny drawing, especially in a newspaper or magazine （尤指报刊上的）漫画
2 a film that tells a story by using moving drawings instead of real people and places 动画片；卡通片

cartoonist
/kɑ:ˈtu:nɪst ||; kɑrˈtunɪst/noun [C] a person who draws cartoons 漫画家

cartridge
/ˈkɑ:trɪdʒ ||; ˈkɑrtrɪdʒ/noun[C]
1 a small tube that contains explosive powder and a bullet. You put a cartridge into a gun when you want to fire it. （枪的）弹药筒，子弹匣
2 a closed container that holds sth that is used in a machine, for example film for a camera, ink for printing, etc. Cartridges can be removed and replaced when they are finished or empty. 密封容器（比如胶卷筒、油墨筒等用完后可以替换的容器）

carve
/kɑ:v ||; kæv/verb
1 [I,T] carve (sth) (out of sth) to cut wood or stone in order to make an object or to put a pattern or writing on it 雕刻: The statue is carved out of marble. 这尊塑像用大理石雕成。 He carved his name on the desk. 他把自己的名字刻在书桌上。
2 [T] to cut a piece of cooked meat into slices 把熟肉切成片: to carve a chicken 把鸡肉切片

carving
/ˈkɑ:vɪŋ ||; ˈkɑrvɪŋ/noun [C,U] an object or design that has been carved 雕刻品: There are ancient carvings on the walls of the cave. 洞壁上面有古代留下的雕刻。

cascade¹
/kæˈskeɪd ||; kæsˈked/noun[C]
1 water that flows down the side of a mountain, etc (a waterfall) 瀑布
2 a large quantity of sth that falls or hangs down 下垂物: a cascade of blond hair 瀑布般下垂的金发
cascade²
/kæˈskeɪd ||; kæsˈked/verb [I] to fall or hang down, especially in large amounts or in stages 下落，下垂（尤指大量的或分阶段的）: Water cascaded from the roof. 水从屋顶泻下。

*case
/keɪs ||; kes/noun
1 [C] a particular situation or example of sth 情况；事例；病例: In some cases, people have had to wait two weeks for a doctor's appointment. 在某些情况下，病人要等两星期才能预约上医生看病。 Most of us travel to work by tube -- or, in Jim's case, by train and tube. 我们大多数人都坐地铁上班─但吉姆既坐火车又坐地铁。 Cases of the disease are very unusual in this country. 这种疾病的病例在这个国家很少见。
2 the case [sing] the true situation 实情: The man said he worked in Cardiff, but we discovered later that this was not the case. 这个男人说他在加的夫干活，但后来我们发现不是这么回事。
3 [C] a crime or legal matter 案件: The police deal with hundreds of murder cases a year. 警方每年要处理几百起谋杀案。 The case will come to court in a few months. 本案将在几个月后开庭审理。
4 [C] [usu.sing] the facts and reasons that support one side in a discussion or legal matter 讨论或诉讼中一方提出的事实或理由: She tried to make a case for shorter working hours, but the others disagreed. 她要求缩短工作时间，但遭到其他人反对。
5 [C] (especially in compounds 尤用于构成复合词) a container or cover for sth 盒；箱；匣: a pencil case 铅笔盒 a pillowcase 枕套 a bookcase 书橱 She put her glasses back in the case. 她把眼镜放回盒内。
6 [C] =SUITCASE Would you like me to carry your case? 我帮你提箱子，好不好？
7 [C,U] (in the grammar of some languages) the form of a noun, an adjective or a pronoun that shows its relationship to another word （在有些语言的语法中，显示名词、形容词或代词跟他词关系的）格: The object of the verb is in the accusative case. 动词的宾语是宾格。 ☞Look at accusative, dative, genitive, nominative and vocative. 参看 accusative、dative、genitive、nominative 及 vocative。
(be) a case of sth/doing sth a situation in which sth is needed 事情；问题: There's no secret to success in this business. It's just a case of hard work. 做这一行成功没有什么秘诀，只是工作努不努力的问题。 in any case whatever happens or has happened; anyway 不管怎样；无论如何: I don't know how much tickets for the match cost, but I'm going in any case. 我不知道这场比赛的门票要多少钱，但我无论如何要去看。 in case because sth might happen 以防: I think I'll take an umbrella in case it rains. 我想我会带伞去，以防下雨。 I wasn't intending to buy anything but I took my credit card just in case. 我本来不打算买东西，但我带着信用卡，以防万一。 in case of sth(formal 正式) if sth happens 一旦；万一: In case of fire, break this glass. 万一失火，砸破这个玻璃。 in that case if that is the situation 如果是那样的话: ‘I'm busy on Tuesday.’ ‘Oh well, in that case we'll have to meet another day.’ “星期二我忙着呢。”“那么我们改天见面吧。” prove your/the case/point→PROVE

ˌcase ˈhistory
noun [C] a record of a person's background, past illnesses, etc 个案史（如个人背景、病历等）

ˈcase law
noun [U] (technical术语) law based on decisions made by judges in earlier legal processes(cases) 判例法 ☞Look at common law and statute law. 参看 common law 及 statute law。

ˈcase study
noun [C] a detailed study of a person, group, situation, etc over a period of time 个案研究

*cash¹
/kæʃ ||; kæʃ/noun [U]:
1 money in the form of coins or notes and not cheques, plastic cards, etc 现金: Would you prefer me to pay in cash or by cheque? 你要我付现金还是付支票？ How much cash have you got with/on you? 你身上有多少现款？ ☞We use cash when we are talking about coins and notes, but change when we are talking about coins only. cash 包括纸币和硬币；如果单指硬币，用 change。
2 (informal 非正式) money in any form 钱: I'm a bit short of cash this month so I can't afford to go out much. 这个月我手头紧，不能常出去玩。 ☞picture at money 见 money 插图
cash²
/kæʃ ||; kæʃ/verb [T] to exchange a cheque, traveller's cheque, etc for coins and notes 兑现: I'm just going to the bank to cash a cheque. 我正想到银行把支票兑现。 cash in (on sth) to take advantage of a situation, especially in a way that other people think is wrong 利用（某种情况）（尤指以别人认为错误的方法）

cashback
/ˈkæʃbæk ||; ˈkæʃbæk/noun [U]:
1 an offer of money as a present that is made by some banks, companies selling cars, etc in order to persuade customers to do business with them 现金回赠（银行、公司等用以吸引顾客的手段）
2 a system in SUPERMARKETS which allows the customer to take money out of his/her bank account at the same time as paying for the goods with a CASH CARD 购物提款（超级市场允许顾客以自动提款卡结账，同时从银行账户提取现金）

ˈcash card
(US 美 ATM card) noun [C] a plastic card given by a bank to its customers so that they can get money from a special machine (cash machine)in or outside a bank 自动提款卡（银行为顾客提供的一种塑料卡，顾客可用以从自动提款机取款） ☞Look at cheque card and credit card. 参看 cheque card 及 credit card。

ˈcash cow
noun [C] a part of a business that always makes a profit and that provides money for the rest of the business 金牛，摇钱树﹙企业中总是赢利的业务﹚

ˈcash crop
noun [C] plants that people grow to sell, and not to eat or use themselves 商品作物；经济作物 ☞Compare subsistence crop. 与 subsistence crop 比较。

ˈcash desk
noun [C] the place in a large shop where you pay for things （大商店的）付款处，付款柜台

cashew
/ˈkæʃu:;kæˈʃu:/ (also cashew nut) noun [C] a small curved nut that we eat 腰果 ☞picture at nut 见 nut 插图

ˈcash flow
noun [sing] the movement of money into and out of a business as goods are bought and sold 现金周转（企业买卖货物过程中钱的进出）: The company had cash-flow problems and could not pay its bills. 公司现金周转不灵，无法支付账单。

cashier
/kæˈʃɪə(r) ||; kæˈʃɪr/noun [C] the person in a bank, shop, etc that customers pay money to or get money from （银行、商店等的）出纳员

ˈcash machine
/ˌeɪ ti: ˈem ||; ˌe ti ˈɛm/ (also cash dispensercashpoint) (US also 美亦作 ATM) noun [C] a machine inside or outside a bank that you can get money from at any time of day by putting in a special card(cash card) 自动提款机

cashmere
/ˈkæʃmɪə(r) ||; ˈkæʃmɪr/noun [U] a type of wool that is very fine and soft 开士米，羊绒，克什米尔羊毛（一种优质山羊绒）

casing
/ˈkeɪsɪŋ ||; ˈkesɪŋ/noun [C,U] a covering that protects sth 盒；套；箱；罩；壳: The keyboard has a black plastic casing. 键盘装在黑色塑料盒里。 ☞picture at Thermos 见 Thermos 插图

casino
/kəˈsi:nəʊ ||; kəˈsino/noun [C] (plural casinos) a place where people play games in which you can win or lose money, such as ROULETTE （内设轮盘及其他赌博玩意儿的）赌场

cask
/kɑ:sk; US kæsk ||; kæsk/noun [C] a large wooden container in which alcoholic drinks, etc are stored （盛酒或装载其他饮料的）大木桶

casket
/ˈkɑ:skɪt ||; ˈkæskɪt/noun[C]
1 a small decorated box for holding jewels or other valuable things, especially in the past 小盒，小箱（盛放珠宝等贵重物品，尤其在旧时）
2 (US 美) =COFFIN

cassava
/kəˈsɑ:və ||; kəˈsɑvə/noun [U] a tropical plant that has thick roots; a type of flour that is made from these roots 木薯；木薯淀粉

casserole
/ˈkæsərəʊl ||; ˈkæsəˌrol/noun
1 [C,U] a type of food that you make by cooking meat and vegetables in liquid for a long time in the oven （把肉和菜焙烧而成的）焙盘菜，砂锅菜: chicken casserole 砂锅鸡
2 [C] a large dish with a lid for cooking casseroles in 焙盘；砂锅 ☞picture at pan 见 pan 插图

*cassette
/kəˈset ||; kəˈsɛt/noun [C] a small flat case with tape inside that you use for recording and playing music and other sounds 盒式录音带；卡式录音带: to put on/play/listen to a cassette 放╱听录音带 Another word for cassette is tape. When you want to go back to the beginning of a cassette you rewind it. When you want to go forward you fast forward it. 把录音带倒回叫rewind﹐倒回的相反就是快进﹐叫做fast forward。

casˈsette recorder
noun [C] a machine that you use for recording and playing cassettes 盒式录音机；卡式录音机

cast¹
/kɑ:st; US kæst ||; kæst/verb (past tense past participle cast)
1 [T] (often passive 常用于被动语态) to choose an actor for a particular role in a play, film, etc 选角；选派演员: She always seems to be cast in the same sort of role. 她似乎总是给派演同一类型的角色。
2 [I,T] to throw a fishing line or net into the water 抛钓线；撒网
3 [T] to make an object by pouring hot liquid metal into a shaped container(a mould) 浇铸: a statue cast in bronze 一座用青铜浇铸的雕像
cast doubt on sth to make people less sure about sth 令人对某事物产生怀疑: The newspaper report casts doubt on the truth of the Prime Minister's statement. 报章的报道使大家对首相的声明的真实性产生怀疑。 cast an eye/your eye(s) over sb/sth to look at sb/sth quickly 瞥；瞟 cast light on sth to help to explain sth 阐明某事物: Can you cast any light on the problem? 你能不能解释一下这个问题？ cast your mind back to make yourself remember sth 想起；回忆起: She cast her mind back to the day she met her husband. 她想起与丈夫相识的那一天。 cast a shadow (across/over sth) to cause an area of shade to appear somewhere 投影 (figurative 比喻) The accident cast a shadow over the rest of the holiday(= stopped people enjoying it fully). 这宗意外使剩下的假期蒙上了阴影。 cast a/your vote to vote 投票: The MPs will cast their votes in the leadership election tomorrow. 明天下议院议员将投票选出领袖。 cast around/about for sth to try to find sth 到处寻找: Jack cast around desperately for a solution to the problem. 杰克拚命想找出解决问题的办法。
cast²
/kɑ:st; US kæst ||; kæst/noun [C] [with.sop] all the actors in a play, film, etc 演员阵容；班底: The entire cast was/were excellent. 整个演员阵容很强。

castaway
/ˈkɑ:stəweɪ ||; ˈkæstəˌwe/noun [C] a person who is left alone somewhere after his/her ship has sunk 海难后被逼与文明世界隔绝的人

caste
/kɑ:st; US kæst ||; kæst/noun [C,U] a social class or group based on your position in society, how much money you have, family origin, etc; the system of dividing people in this way （根据社会地位、金钱、家庭出身等来划分的）社会等级；种姓制度: Hindu society is based on a caste system. 印度社会是建立在种姓制度上的。

caster sugar
/ˌkɑ:stə ˈʃʊgə(r) ||; ˈkæstɚ ˌʃυgɚ/ (also castor sugar) noun [U] (Brit 英) white sugar in the form of very small grains, used in cooking 精白砂糖

ˌcast-ˈiron
adj made of cast iron 铸铁造的 (figurative 比喻) a cast-iron alibi (= one that people cannot doubt) 案发时不在现场的铁证

ˌcast ˈiron
noun [U] a hard type of iron 铸铁；生铁

*castle
/ˈkɑ:sl; US ˈkæsl ||; ˈkæsḷ/noun[C]
1 a large building with high walls and towers that was built in the past to defend people against attack 堡垒；城堡: a medieval castle 中世纪城堡 Edinburgh Castle 爱丁堡古堡
2 in the game of CHESS any of the four pieces placed in the corner squares of the board at the start of the game, usually made to look like a castle （国际象棋的）车

ˈcast-off
noun [C] [usu.pl] a piece of clothing that you no longer want and that you give to sb else or throw away （被丢弃的）旧衣服: When I was little I had to wear my sister's cast-offs. 我小时候得穿姐姐的旧衣服。

castrate
/kæˈstreɪt; US ˈkæstreɪt ||; ˈkæstret/verb [T] to remove part of the sexual organs of a male animal so that it cannot produce young 阉割；去势 ☞Look at neuter ². 参看 neuter^2。 ➔castration /kæˈstreɪʃn ||; kæsˈtreʃən/ noun [U]

casual
/ˈkæʒuəl ||; ˈkæʒυəl/adj
1 relaxed and not worried; not showing great effort or interest 漫不经心的: I'm not happy about your casual attitude to your work. 我不满意你那种漫不经心的工作态度。 It was only a casual remark so I don't know why he got so angry. 我只不过随口说说，真想不通他为何大动肝火。
2 (used about clothes) not formal （指衣着）随便的: I always change into casual clothes as soon as I get home from work. 我下班回家以后总是立刻换上便服。
3 (used about work) done only for a short period; not regular or permanent （指工作）临时的: Most of the building work was done by casual labourers. 这座大厦的兴建工作大半由临时工承担。 a casual job 临时工作；兼职工作 ➔casually /ˈkæʒuəli ||; ˈkæʒυəlɪ/ adv She walked in casually and said, ‘I'm not late, am I?’ 她从容不迫地走进来说﹕“我没迟到吧，对吗？” Dress casually, it won't be a formal party. 穿得随便一点，那不会是个正式的宴会。

casualty
/ˈkæʒuəlti ||; ˈkæʒυəltɪ/noun (plural casualties)
1 [C] a person who is killed or injured in a war or an accident 伤亡者: After the accident the casualties were taken to hospital. 意外发生之后，伤亡者被送往医院。
2 [C] a person or thing that suffers as a result of sth else 受害者: Many small companies became casualties of the economic crisis. 很多小公司成了这次经济危机的受害者。
3 (also casualty department) (US 美 eˈmergency roomER) [U] the part of a hospital where people who have been injured in accidents are taken for immediate treatment 急救室；急诊室

*cat
/kæt ||; kæt/noun[C]
1 a small animal with soft fur that people often keep as a pet 猫
2 a wild animal of the cat family 猫科动物: the big cats (= lions, tigers, etc) 大型猫科动物（如狮、虎等）
A young cat is called a kitten. A male cat is called a tom. When a cat makes a soft sound of pleasure, it purrs. When it makes a louder sound, it miaows. 小猫叫做kitten，雄猫叫做tom。猫的叫声有两种：呼噜作声，叫做 purr；咪咪喵喵地叫，就是miaow。

catalogue
/ˈkætəlɒg; US -lɔ:g ||; ˈkætḷˌɔg/ (US 美 catalog) noun [C]
1 a list of all the things that you can buy, see, etc somewhere 目录
2 a series, especially of bad things 一连串（尤指不幸事件）: a catalogue of disasters/errors/injuries 接二连三的灾难╱错误╱伤害 catalogue verb She started to catalogue all the new library books. 她着手给图书馆所有的新书编目录。

catalyse
/ˈkætəlaɪz ||; ˈkætḷˌaɪz/ (US 美 catalyze) verb [T] to make a chemical reaction happen faster 催化 ➔catalysis /kəˈtæləsɪs ||; kəˈtæləsɪs/ noun [U]

catalyst
/ˈkætəlɪst ||; ˈkætḷɪst/noun[C]
1 a catalyst (for sth) a person or a thing that causes change 引起变化的人或事物: The scandal was the catalyst for the President's election defeat. 这丑闻是促使总统落选的重要因素。
2 a substance that makes a chemical reaction happen faster 催化剂 catalytic /ˌkætəˈlɪtɪk ||; ˌkætḷˈɪtɪk/ adj

ˌcataˌlytic conˈverter
noun [C] a device used in motor vehicles to reduce the damage caused to the environment by poisonous gases 催化式排气净化器

catamaran
/ˌkætəməˈræn ||; ˌkætəməˈræn/noun [C] a fast sailing boat with twoHULLS(= with two main parts to its structure, like two boats joined together) 双体船 ☞picture at boat 见 boat 插图

catapult¹
/ˈkætəpʌlt ||; ˈkætəˌpʌlt/ (US 美 slingshot) noun [C] a Y-shaped stick with a piece of elastic tied to each side that is used by children for shooting stones 弹弓（儿童玩的）
catapult²
/ˈkætəpʌlt ||; ˈkætəˌpʌlt/verb [T] to throw sb/sth suddenly and with great force 掷；抛；甩: When the car crashed the driver was catapulted through the windscreen. 汽车撞毁时，司机穿过挡风玻璃，被抛出车外。 (figurative 比喻) The success of his first film catapulted him to fame. 他的第一部影片成功以后一举成名。

cataract
/ˈkætərækt ||; ˈkætəˌrækt/noun[C]
1 a white area that grows over the eye as a result of disease 白内障
2 a large WATERFALL(= a place where a river falls down a steep cliff or rock) 大瀑布

catarrh
/kəˈtɑ:(r) ||; kəˈtɑr/noun [U] a thick liquid that forms in the nose and throat when you have a cold （伤风时在鼻喉部形成的）黏液；卡他

catastrophe
/kəˈtæstrəfi ||; kəˈtæstrəfɪ/noun[C]
1 a sudden disaster that causes great suffering or damage 大灾难: major catastrophes such as floods and earthquakes 洪水和地震之类的大灾难
2 an event that causes great difficulty, disappointment, etc （给人带来困难、失望等的）大败，惨败: It'll be a catastrophe if I fail the exam again. 要是我这次考试再不及格，那就惨了。 ➔catastrophic /ˌkætəˈstrɒfɪk ||; ˌkætəˈstrɑfɪk/ adj The war had a catastrophic effect on the whole country. 战争对整个国家产生灾难性的影响。

*catch¹
/kætʃ ||; kætʃ/verb (past tense past participle caught /kɔ:t ||; kɔt/)
1 [T] to take hold of sth that is moving, usually with your hand or hands 接住: The dog caught the ball in its mouth. 狗用嘴巴把球接住。
2 [T] to capture sb/sth that you have been following or looking for 捉住: Two policemen ran after the thief and caught him at the end of the street. 两个警察追着那个小偷，终于在街的尽头把他逮住。 to catch a fish 捉鱼
3 [T] to notice or see sb doing sth bad 撞见（劣行）: I caught her taking money from my purse. 我及时撞见她从我的钱包偷钱。
4 [T] to get on a bus, train, plane, etc 登上（公共汽车、火车、飞机等）: I caught the bus into town. 我搭上进城那班公共汽车。 [OPP] miss 反义词为 miss
5 [T] to be in time for sth; not to miss sb/sth 赶上: We arrived just in time to catch the beginning of the film. 我们刚好赶上电影开场。 I'll phone her now. I might just catch her before she leaves the office. 我现在就给她打电话，也许能在她离开办公室之前找到她。
6 [I,T] to become or cause sth to become accidentally connected to or stuck in sth （使）绊住: His jacket caught on a nail and ripped. 他的夹克给钉子勾破了。 If we leave early we won't get caught in the traffic. 我们早一点出发的话，就不会给路上的交通耽搁。
7 [T] to hit sb/sth 打击；击中: The branch caught him on the head. 树枝打在他的头上。
8 [T] to get an illness 得病: to catch a cold/flu/measles 患感冒；患流感；染上痲疹
9 [T] to hear or understand sth that sb says 听到；领会: I'm sorry, I didn't quite catch what you said. Could you repeat it? 对不起，我不大明白你的意思，可不可以再说一遍？
catch sb's attention/eye to make sb notice sth 引起注意: I tried to catch the waiter's eye so that I could get the bill. 我想引起服务员的注意，好让他给我结账。 catch your breath
1 to rest after physical exercise so that your breathing returns to normal 歇息: I had to sit down at the top of the hill to catch my breath. 我不得不在山顶上坐下来歇口气。
2 to breathe in suddenly because you are surprised （因吃惊而）屏息
